targets.expr:
(((count by (instance) (count(node_cpu_seconds_total{job=~"$job",instance=~"$instance"}) by (cpu, instance))) 
- 
avg by (instance) (sum by (instance, mode)(irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode='idle',job=~"$job",instance=~"$instance"}[$__rate_interval])))) * 100) 
/ 
count by(instance) (count(node_cpu_seconds_total{job=~"$job",instance=~"$instance"}) by (cpu, instance))

100-(max by (instance) (node_filesystem_avail_bytes{job=~"$job",instance=~"$instance", fstype!="", mountpoint="/"})
/
max by (instance) (node_filesystem_size_bytes{job=~"$job",instance=~"$instance", fstype!="", mountpoint="/"}) * 100)
count by (instance) (max_over_time(ALERTS{job=~"$job",instance=~"$instance", alertstate="firing", severity="critical"}[1m])) * group by (instance) (node_uname_info{job=~"$job",instance=~"$instance"})
count by (instance) (max_over_time(ALERTS{job=~"$job",instance=~"$instance", alertstate="firing", severity="warning"}[1m])) * group by (instance) (node_uname_info{job=~"$job",instance=~"$instance"})

panels.description: State of the Alerts in orgs
panels.title: Alerts State

panels.description: There should always be at least 3 containers running (node_exporter, cadvisor, alloy). This panel does not check for these 3 containers in particular. Just if there are at least 3 containers up-and-running.
panels.title: Running containers

panels.description: The number of Alloy instances whose metrics are being sent and reported.
panels.title: Running instances

panels.description: The number of running components across all running instances.
panels.title: Running components

panels.description: The percentage of components which are in a healthy state.
panels.title: Overall component health

panels.description:
Breakdown of components by health across all running instances.

* Healthy: components have been evaluated completely and are reporting themselves as healthy.
* Unhealthy: Components either could not be evaluated or are reporting themselves as unhealthy.
* Unknown: A component has been created but has not yet been started.
* Exited: A component has exited. It will not return to the running state.

More information on a component's health state can be retrieved using
the Alloy UI.

Note that components may be in a degraded state even if they report
themselves as healthy. Use component-specific dashboards and alerts
to observe detailed information about the behavior of a component.
panels.title: Components by health

panels.description: Shows if metrics are being received for the selected time range.

targets.expr: vector(1) and on() ((count(up{job=~"$job"} == 1) > 0) and (absent(absent(alloy_resources_process_cpu_seconds_total{job=~"$job"})))) or vector(0) and on() ((count(up{job=~"$job"}) > 0) and (absent(alloy_resources_process_cpu_seconds_total{job=~"$job"})))

panels.title: Metrics

panels.description: Shows the timestamp of the latest metrics received for this integration in the last 24 hours.
